page.title: 04MARSHES FARM,CHIPSTAPLE (1)
page.content: The Stevens family live at Marshes Farm, Chipstable.The farmland is steep and very hilly. The farm is a beef and sheep farm. The Stevens family own 180 acres. The kind of sheep they own are Exmoor Horn ewes and Suffolk and Hampshire Down rams. Breeding is done by putting the Exmoor Horn ewe with the Suffolk ram. They keep all the ewe lambs and then, when they are old enough,they put them with the Hampshire Down ram and then sell the lambs. They have 250 ewes and 50 hogs (young lambs). They lamb their ewes in February in sheep sheds, and when the lambs are strong enough they go outside. The Stevens also own beef cattle, and they have one milking cow which provides their own milk. Mr Stevens milks his cow by hand.
